uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression

Class LockingExpressionImpl<S extends Expression<S,T>,T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.co.strangeskies.utilities.ObservableImpl<S>
      • uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.ExpressionImpl<S,T>
        • uk.co.strangeskies.mathematics.expression.LockingExpressionImpl<S,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - the self-bound of the expression, i.e. the type of the expression object itself
    T - The type of the value of this expression
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression<S,T>, LockingExpression<S,T>, Copyable<S>, Observable<S>, Self<S>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractFunctionBuffer, BooleanValue, IdentityExpression

    public abstract class LockingExpressionImpl<S extends Expression<S,T>,T>
extends ExpressionImpl<S,T>
implements LockingExpression<S,T>
    An abstract class to help designing mutable expression, implementing a simple observer list, locking mechanism, and update mechanism.

      • getValue

        public final T getValue()
        Description copied from interface: Expression
        This should always return the correct current value for this Expression. Be careful to remember that the reference returned should not be able to mutate this Expression, i.e. it should be either an immutable class, a const reference, or a copy of the underlying value. This is important, but conversely it does not mean that the return value can necessarily be relied upon not to not mutate when this expression is updated, unless a read lock is held.

        Once a value has been returned, it is up to the implementing Expression as to whether the value will be reliable such that it will remain the same even if the conceptual value of this expression subsequently changes, or whether it will update automatically with the expression. Please only rely on either behaviour if it is explicitly documented, otherwise use Expression.decoupleValue() if you need a persistent reference which is safe to mutate and/or safe from external mutation.

        The observers should only ever be notified of an update from the thread which has the write lock on an Expression, and Expressions should be careful to only notify observers when they are in a state where their value can be fetched. Immediate fetch is discouraged, though. Expressions should generally update lazily, not eagerly.

        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Expression<S extends Expression<S,T>,T>
        Overrides:
        getValue in class ExpressionImpl<S extends Expression<S,T>,T>
        Returns:
        The fully evaluated value of this Expression at the time of method invocation.

      • getValueImpl

        protected abstract T getValueImpl(boolean dirty)
        Implementing classes should compute the value of the Expression here. Read lock is guaranteed to be obtained. This method should never be invoked manually.
        Specified by:
        getValueImpl in class ExpressionImpl<S extends Expression<S,T>,T>
        Parameters:
        dirty - Whether the expression has been mutated since this method was last invoked.
        Returns:
        The value of this Expression.
